text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle PCRs imported via the Billing API?

text: Imported PCRs are imported as incomplete claims. You can view all incomplete claims on the Dashboard by clicking "Pick claims" and then the date of the import. Imported claims are assigned a status of incomplete with a status reason of "Incomplete - Verify patient account". This means that some aspects of the patient demographic information in the imported claim matches existing records.

text.text: What are the possible statuses assigned to claims imported via the Billing API?

text: If you see TBD in the "Status" column, it means that the import was successful but the system was unable to verify the patient account.

text.text: Can you explain the difference between "Incomplete - Verify patient account" and "Incomplete" statuses for imported claims?

text: Incomplete - Verify patient account means that some aspects of the patient demographic information in the imported claim matches existing records. Incomplete means that the demographics of the imported claim did not exist in the system at the time of the import.

text.text: How can users find imported claims with incomplete statuses on the Dashboard?

text: The Dashboard will let you know how many unassigned incomplete claims there are in the system. If you see a number accompanied by a Work button, it's time to get those incomplete claims done.

text.text: What does it mean if a claim is in the "Incomplete - Verify patient account" section on the Dashboard?

text: If a claim is in the "Incomplete - Verify patient account" section on the Dashboard, it means that some aspects of the patient demographic information in the imported claim matches existing records. You do not work the claims in this section, only verify the patient information.

text.text: How can users verify patient information for claims in the "Incomplete - Verify patient account" section?

text: To verify patient information, click the Work button next to Incomplete - Verify patient account and verify the patient accounts first. Clicking the Pick claims button next to Incomplete will not work until the claim(s) are verified.

text.text: What actions should users take for claims in the "Incomplete" section on the Dashboard?

text: For claims in the "Incomplete" section on the Dashboard, users should verify the patient accounts first. Clicking the Pick claims button next to Incomplete will not work until the claim(s) are verified.

text.text: Is there a way to prioritize which imported claims to work on first?

text: There are a couple of ways to work unassigned, incomplete new claims. One way is to click Work oldest. The system will serve up the first incomplete, unassigned claim with the oldest date of service.

text.text: How can users access the Imported Claims page in ZOLL Billing?

text: All users have access to the Claim Imports and Claim Submissions pages. You can view all incomplete claims on the Dashboard. Click "Pick claims" and then pick the date of the import.

text.text: What types of imported claims are displayed on the Imported Claims page?

text: The Imported Claims page displays a list of import files and claim numbers generated by the import. The most recent imported file displays at the top of the page. You can identify the file by its file name, import date or PCR number.

text.text: How can users differentiate between successful, unsuccessful, and duplicate imports on the Imported Claims page?

text: The Import Claims page displays a message that reads "Not imported: duplicate of existing claim" if the eRecord.01 value in the NEMSIS file is not unique.

text.text: What does it mean if an import status contains an error with an information icon?

text: If the import status contains an error with an information icon, it means that the import was not successful.

text.text: Can you provide a summary of the process for managing PCRs imported via the Billing API in ZOLL Billing?

text: Imported PCRs come into ZOLL Billing as incomplete claims. You can view all incomplete claims on the Dashboard. To prevent duplication of patient records, ZOLL Billing conducts a thorough search of existing records to identify any that share the same name, date of birth, and/or address.

text.text: Are there any specific actions users need to take for unsuccessful imports on the Imported Claims page?

text: If the import status contains an error with an information icon, it means that the import was not successful. The user will need to review the error message and take the necessary steps to correct the issue.

text.text: How does ZOLL Billing handle duplicate imports of PCRs?

text: ZOLL Billing tries to minimize duplicates by constantly comparing the name, SSN, address, and date of birth of existing records with the information being entered/imported. If a possible duplicate exists, the system presents the patient data and asks you to choose the correct information.

text.text: How to find imported claim?

text: To find imported claims, you can hover over Claims on the navigation bar and click Imported claims. The most recent imported file displays at the top of the page. You can identify the file by its file name, import date, or PCR number.

text.text: This page displays successful, unsuccessful, and duplicate imports

text: To find imported claims, you can hover over Claims on the navigation bar and click Imported claims. The most recent imported file displays at the top of the page. You can identify the file by its file name, import date, or PCR number.

text.text: How do I manually import claims in ZOLL Billing?

text: There are several ways to bring claims into ZOLL Billing: import a NEMSIS file, import PCRs through the Billing API, or manually create a claim. Imported claims are assigned a status of incomplete with a status reason of.

text.text: Can you guide me through the process of importing claims manually?

text:
To manually import a claim, you will need to create a new claim in ZOLL Billing. To do this, hover over Claims on the navigation bar and click New claim. In the Claim Information section, enter the following information:

* Claim type: Select the type of claim you are creating.
* Claim number: Enter the claim number.
* Patient ID: Enter the patient ID.
* Date of service: Enter the date of service.
* Amount: Enter the amount of the claim.
* Insurance carrier: Select the insurance carrier.
* Policy number: Enter the policy number.
* Patient name: Enter the patient's name.
* Patient address: Enter the patient's address.
* Patient phone number: Enter the patient's phone number.
* Patient email address: Enter the patient's email address.

Once you have entered all of the required information, click Save. The claim will be saved and you will be

text.text: Where can I find the option to import claims manually in ZOLL Billing?

text: To manually import a claim, you will need to create a new claim in ZOLL Billing. To do this, hover over Claims on the navigation bar and click New claim. In the Claim Information section, enter the following information:

text.text: What file format does ZOLL Billing support for manual claim imports?

text: ZOLL Billing supports the following file formats for manual claim imports:.

text.text: How do I select the file to import when using the manual claim import feature?

text: To manually import a claim, you will need to create a new claim in ZOLL Billing. To do this, hover over Claims on the navigation bar and click New claim. In the Claim Information section, enter the following information: Service date, Patient first name, Middle name, Last name, Date of birth, Sex, Social security number, Country, Residential address line 1, Address line 2, City, State, ZIP Code

text.text: What happens after I click "Create claims" during the manual import process?

text: When you click "Create claims", the system will serve up the first incomplete, unassigned claim with the oldest date of service. When you are done with the first one, the system will serve up the next oldest, and so on, until there are no more.

text.text: How can I verify if a manual claim import was successful?

text: If you see TBD in the "Claim #" column, it means that the import was successful but the system was unable to verify the patient account. You can view all incomplete claims on the Dashboard.

text.text: What should I do if there is a possible duplicate record during manual claim import?

text: If there is a possible duplicate record during manual claim import, you will need to verify whether the patient information on the imported PCR is a duplicate before you create the claim.

text.text: How do I access the list of imported claims after manual import?

text: You can always see a list of import files and claim numbers generated by the import by hovering over Claims on the navigation bar and then clicking "Imported Claims". On the import file line, click the claim number to view the incomplete claim.

text.text: What does each status in the "Import status" column mean on the Imported Claims page?

text: The "Import status" column on the Imported Claims page shows the status of the import process.

text.text: What should I do if the import status indicates that the claim creation failed?

text:
If the import status indicates that the claim creation failed, you will need to troubleshoot the issue. To do this, you can review the following:

* The import file format.
* The import file data.
* The import file settings.

If you are still unable to resolve the issue, you can contact ZOLL Billing support for assistance.

text.text: How can I troubleshoot issues if the file failed validation during manual claim import?

text:
If the file failed validation during manual claim import, you can troubleshoot the issue by reviewing the following:

* The import file format
* The import file data
* The import file settings

text.text: Is there a maximum file size limit for manual claim imports in ZOLL Billing?

text: The file size limit for claim attachments is 500 MB.

text.text: Who should I contact if I encounter issues with manual claim imports in ZOLL Billing?

text: If you have unworked incomplete claims, the system serves up the oldest incomplete claim for you to work. It may not be the same claim you just imported. Both methods bring you to the first tab in the incomplete claims workflow - "Patient details".
